name: Tropical Hemorrhagic Leptospirosis
chief_complaint: I have high fever, muscle pain, and my eyes are yellow
treatment: intravenous penicillin G (1.5 million units every 6 hours)
prognosis: Mortality rate 5-15% in severe cases. Early treatment improves outcomes but may require prolonged recovery of liver/kidney function.
description: Severe form of leptospirosis (Weil's disease) caused by Leptospira interrogans, characterized by hepatic dysfunction, renal failure, and hemorrhagic manifestations. Transmission occurs through contact with contaminated water or soil containing urine from infected animals (often rodents). Incubation period 2-30 days (typically 5-14 days).
risk_factors: recreational water activities in endemic areas
residence in tropical regions with poor sanitation
